sub_title: Associate Professor in Geoarchaeology and Anthropocene Studies at Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam
summary: Working on the interface of geology and archaeology, establishing international networks, performing consulting and mapping activities, in the field of academia and commercial enterprises. Through integrated and interdisciplinary projects establishing the highest quality of work. Such as: 3D visualisation in the subsurface with geological and archaeological data, inventory of earth scientific values in national parks, DEM analysis and mapping of geological data to assist archaeological policy making decisions. Currently (2019-2023) coordinating EU Horizon 2020 project TERRANOVA (15 PhDs) and (co-)supervising 7 PhD students in geoarchaeology, landscape archaeology and Anthropocene studies.

projects.title: LAC 2014 Rome deadline abstracts 1st of  April!
projects.description: Landscape archaeology is a rapidly expanding field of research that is covered by scholars from an increasing number of disciplines, such as archaeology, earth sciences, historical geography, ecology and anthropology. In order to stimulate international debate and exchange of research experiences and theoretical ideas between these disciplines, in 2010 it was decided to start a series conferences at two years intervals. This year LAC2014 will take place in Rome, at the Netherlands and Swedish Institutes in Rome, from the 17th – 20th of September 2014.

contributors.headline: Associate Professor in Geoarchaeology and Anthropocene Studies at Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam

Senior Policy Officer Research, Faculty Religion and Theology VU

projects.title: Vlaardingen Stadshart
projects.description: Vlaardingen Stadshart is one of the oldest city centres in the Netherlands and has revealed old and valuable archaeological material , incl. DNA. To secure the future of this vulnerable soil archive currently an extensive interdisciplinary research (mechanical drilling, grain size, TGA, archeological remains, osteology, hydrology, dating methods, micromorphology, microfauna, molluscs, diatoms) has started in 2011 to gain knowledge on the internal structure of the mound as well as on the well-preserved nature of the archaeological evidence.

contributors.headline: Associate Professor in Geoarchaeology and Anthropocene Studies at Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam

projects.title: North South line Amsterdam
projects.description: Digging into the old history of Amsterdam. As a geologist fascinated by the opportunity that such a vast infrastructural project has to offer both to archaeology and geology. We are working towards a comprehensive story telling the history of the landscape of Amsterdam and its (early) inhabitants. This is an ongoing project.

company.name: Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam, department of Archaeology

profile_positions.company: Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam, department of Archaeology
profile_positions.description:
Teaching courses within the domains of Humanities and Earth Sciences. Supervising and guiding  PhD, MSc, MA, BSc and BA students, working in CLUE+, board member of Environmental Humanities Center and International Association of Landscape Archaeoology. Fieldwork in Northwest Europe, Mediterranean and Middle East areas. 

Sjoerd is Director of the International Association of Landscape Archaeology and co-leads the Environmental Humanities Center . He has vast experience in convening interdisciplinary sessions in soils, landscapes and archaeology at EGU, EAA and LAC and is and has been guest and executive editor of more than ten special volumes dedicated to this theme (e.g. QI, 2012, 2013; 2017 Catena, 2015, 2016; SOIL, 2016, 2017; VUA 2016).
profile_positions.title: Associate Professor Geoarchaeology and Anthropocene Sciences

profile_positions.description:
As a geologist and physical geographer involved in applying earth sciences to archaeology. Project management in (field-based) evaluation of archaeological monuments and initiator and project manager of involving cultural history in planning processes (drowned villages in the southwestern Netherlands; Belvedere project). Education: offering courses on the landscape of The Netherlands and the North Sea to professionals working in the landscape.

GEO-LOGICAL is a research and consulting company in earth sciences and works for government agencies and cultural historical and archaeological companies. Sjoerd has a special interest in interdisciplinary research and educational activities.
profile_positions.title: Earth Scientist

company.name: The University of Stirling, School of Natural Sciences

profile_positions.company: The University of Stirling, School of Natural Sciences
profile_positions.description: Teaching courses in Geoarchaeology to students of the domains of Environmental Sciences and Humanities; Building interdisciplinary networks to sustainable international cooperation in higher education.
profile_positions.title: Associate Professor Geoarchaeology

profile_positions.description:
As Assistant Professor responsible for teaching BSc and MSc courses in Landscape Archaeology to archaeologists and geoarchaeologists. Responsible and initiator for organising the 1st International Landscape Archaeology Conference (LAC2010) at the VU Amsterdam. Convening sessions in Soil as a Record of the Past (Vice-chair in the section) and Geoarchaeology at the General Assembly of the European Geosciences Union (EGU) in 2012 and 2013. Coordinating departmental seminar series and PhD student monitoring progress at IGBA. 

Sjoerd is member of the Research Institute for Cultural Landscape and Urban Environment  (CLUE) at the VU University Amsterdam. Sjoerd is teaching landscape archaeology and is supervising landscape archaeological fieldwork projects (BA, MSc, PhD) in Northwestern Europe and the Mediterranean area.

Sjoerd leads the International Association of Landscape Archaeology and the Environmental Humanities Center . He has vast experience in convening interdisciplinary sessions in soils, landscapes and archaeology at EGU, EAA and LAC and is and has been guest and executive editor of more than ten special volumes dedicated to this theme (e.g. QI, 2012, 2013; 2017 Catena, 2015, 2016; SOIL, 2016, 2017; VUA 2016).
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor

profile_positions.description: Editor of maps and profiles, creating reports: Edited geological maps and profiles on stratigraphy and quaternary geology of the southwestern Netherlands. Edited geological maps and explanatory notes. Created and adapted geological maps in the western Netherlands. Created and edited explanatory notes, geomorphological maps, SE Netherlands. Edited course 'Geology and Ice Ages' . Created, and reported on, maps and profiles on occurrence of surface minerals in the eastern Netherlands. Created and edited explanatory notes, geomorphological maps, W Netherlands.
